{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Account Payable Officer",
  "description": "Uncle Stans Food is a quick service restaurant (QSR) , a fast-food model built for speed and convenience, featuring a limited, standardized menu of items like small shops or pizza. Operating primarily through counter-service and drive-thrus, it focuses on rapid food assembly from pre-prepared components, ensuring consistent, affordable meals delivered in minutes. Our functional, casual environment prioritizes efficient turnover over prolonged dining, making it a dominant global industry by fulfilling the demand for reliable, on-the-go satisfaction.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Payable Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities &amp; Duties


	Process Accounts Payable invoices in line with business rules
	Matching invoice to Purchase Orders and Goods Receipt Note
	Enter matched invoices accurately
	Run invoices due for payment report for approval
	Upload payment files for approval
	Process credit notes and match to supplier invoices
	Track and process approved employee expense claims
	Perform monthly supplier reconciliation
	Maintain supplier master file
	Ensure timely response to supplier queries
	Prepare analyses of accounts and produce monthly reports
	Drive continuous improvement across the Accounts Payable process.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 2-3 years of experience.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;emmy@unclestansfoods.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.",

Account Payable Officer Job at Uncle Stan's Food




        
    

        
        Uncle Stans Food is a quick service restaurant (QSR) , a fast-food model built for speed and convenience, featuring a limited, standardized menu of items like small shops or pizza. Operating primarily through counter-service and drive-thrus, it focuses on rapid food assembly from pre-prepared components, ensuring consistent, affordable meals delivered in minutes. Our functional, casual environment prioritizes efficient turnover over prolonged dining, making it a dominant global industry by fulfilling the demand for reliable, on-the-go satisfaction.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Payable Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Responsibilities & Duties


	Process Accounts Payable invoices in line with business rules
	Matching invoice to Purchase Orders and Goods Receipt Note
	Enter matched invoices accurately
	Run invoices due for payment report for approval
	Upload payment files for approval
	Process credit notes and match to supplier invoices
	Track and process approved employee expense claims
	Perform monthly supplier reconciliation
	Maintain supplier master file
	Ensure timely response to supplier queries
	Prepare analyses of accounts and produce monthly reports
	Drive continuous improvement across the Accounts Payable process.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 2-3 years of experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: emmy@unclestansfoods.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Medical Laboratory Scientist",
  "description": "Shalina Healthcare is one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in sub-Saharan Africa. For the last 35 years, we have made it our mission to provide quality medicines to those who need it the most. We manufacture and distribute branded prescription and over-the-counter pharmaceutical and consumer products across various therapeutic groups, including anti-malarial, antibiotics, anti-inflammatory, and nutrition. We have a track record few can match and our brands are among the most trusted in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Medical Laboratory Scientist
Job ID:&nbsp;JOB-370
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos

Job Description


	This role is crucial to ensure the accurate and efficient handling of specimens from receipt through processing, maintaining the highest standards of quality and patient care.


What to Expect


	Perform a wide range of microbiological tests including culture, sensitivity, and identification of pathogens.
	Analyze specimens such as blood, urine, tissue, and other body fluids.
	Maintain, calibrate, and troubleshoot laboratory instruments and equipment.
	Ensure compliance with all laboratory policies, quality assurance, and safety standards.
	Record and interpret results accurately; communicate findings to healthcare providers when necessary.
	Participate in continuous education and training programs.
	Maintain a clean and organized work environment.


Essential Education, Experience and Skills


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in medical laboratory science (BMLS)
	Minimum of 3-5years of post-NYSC experience in a medical laboratory, with strong expertise in Microbiology.
	Valid license from the Medical Laboratory Science Council of Nigeria (MLSCN)
	Conversant with good laboratory practice.
	Strong attention to detail and analytical skills.
	Good communication and teamwork skills.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-13",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-14",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Shalina Healthcare"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "191799"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Medical Laboratory Scientist Job at Shalina Healthcare




        
    

        
        Shalina Healthcare is one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in sub-Saharan Africa. For the last 35 years, we have made it our mission to provide quality medicines to those who need it the most. We manufacture and distribute branded prescription and over-the-counter pharmaceutical and consumer products across various therapeutic groups, including anti-malarial, antibiotics, anti-inflammatory, and nutrition. We have a track record few can match and our brands are among the most trusted in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Laboratory Scientist
Job ID: JOB-370
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	This role is crucial to ensure the accurate and efficient handling of specimens from receipt through processing, maintaining the highest standards of quality and patient care.


What to Expect


	Perform a wide range of microbiological tests including culture, sensitivity, and identification of pathogens.
	Analyze specimens such as blood, urine, tissue, and other body fluids.
	Maintain, calibrate, and troubleshoot laboratory instruments and equipment.
	Ensure compliance with all laboratory policies, quality assurance, and safety standards.
	Record and interpret results accurately; communicate findings to healthcare providers when necessary.
	Participate in continuous education and training programs.
	Maintain a clean and organized work environment.


Essential Education, Experience and Skills


	Bachelor's Degree in medical laboratory science (BMLS)
	Minimum of 3-5years of post-NYSC experience in a medical laboratory, with strong expertise in Microbiology.
	Valid license from the Medical Laboratory Science Council of Nigeria (MLSCN)
	Conversant with good laboratory practice.
	Strong attention to detail and analytical skills.
	Good communication and teamwork skills.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "IT Officer",
  "description": "Quest Employment -&nbsp;Our client, one of the leading name in the supermarket and retail industry, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Officer&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Manage information technology and computer systems.
	Plan, organize, control and evaluate IT and electronic data operations.
	Manage IT staff by recruiting, training and coaching employees, communicating job expectations. and appraising their performance.
	Design, develop, implement and coordinate systems, policies and procedures.
	Ensure security of data, network access and backup systems.
	Act in alignment with user needs and system functionality to contribute to organizational policy.
	Identify problematic areas and implement strategic solutions in time.
	Audit systems and assess their outcomes.
	Preserve assets, information security and control structures.
	Handle annual budget and ensure cost effectiveness.
	Monitoring daily operations, including server hardware, software, and operating systems.
	Coordinating technology installations, upgrades, and maintenance.
	Selecting and purchasing new and replacement hardware and software, when necessary.
	Testing, troubleshooting, and modifying information systems so that they operate effectively.
	Generating performance reports for operating systems.
	Evaluating technology risks in order to develop a network disaster recovery plan and backup procedures.
	Running regular checks on network and data security
	Identifying and acting on opportunities to improve and update software and systems
	Developing and implementing IT policy and best practice guides for the organisation
	CCTV experience.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 / month.

Other Benefits:


	Pension + HMO + Feeding + 3th Month.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;questemployment247@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-19",

  },

}



IT Officer Job at Quest Employment Limited




        
    

        
        Quest Employment - Our client, one of the leading name in the supermarket and retail industry, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Officer 

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Manage information technology and computer systems.
	Plan, organize, control and evaluate IT and electronic data operations.
	Manage IT staff by recruiting, training and coaching employees, communicating job expectations. and appraising their performance.
	Design, develop, implement and coordinate systems, policies and procedures.
	Ensure security of data, network access and backup systems.
	Act in alignment with user needs and system functionality to contribute to organizational policy.
	Identify problematic areas and implement strategic solutions in time.
	Audit systems and assess their outcomes.
	Preserve assets, information security and control structures.
	Handle annual budget and ensure cost effectiveness.
	Monitoring daily operations, including server hardware, software, and operating systems.
	Coordinating technology installations, upgrades, and maintenance.
	Selecting and purchasing new and replacement hardware and software, when necessary.
	Testing, troubleshooting, and modifying information systems so that they operate effectively.
	Generating performance reports for operating systems.
	Evaluating technology risks in order to develop a network disaster recovery plan and backup procedures.
	Running regular checks on network and data security
	Identifying and acting on opportunities to improve and update software and systems
	Developing and implementing IT policy and best practice guides for the organisation
	CCTV experience.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 / month.

Other Benefits:


	Pension + HMO + Feeding + 3th Month.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: questemployment247@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
